dji.sdk.api.GroundStation

Class DJIPhantomGroundStation

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIGroundStation
        • dji.sdk.api.GroundStation.DJIPhantomGroundStation

  • public class DJIPhantomGroundStation
extends DJIGroundStation

    Dji vision ground station class

    Extending the DJIGroundStation, the DJIPhantomGroundStation is designed for Phantom.

    Before you use the API of GroundStation, you should make sure that you have the SDK-LEVEL-2 key so that the authority would allow you to invoke the API.

    DJIGroundStation class would provide a series of operations for controlling the drone. It could satisfy your requirement of manually controlling the drone by app, set up a cruise. Please note that during the execution of ground station, no more additional way points could be uploaded to the drone.

    For further understanding the API of ground station, we provide a guideline for operating.

    Step1 :openGroundStation() for opening the ground station so that the connection between app and drone could be set up.
    Step2 :uploadGroundStationTask() for uploading the tasks which the customers required to do.
    Step3 :startGroundStationTask() to send a signal for starting the tasks.
    Step4 :pauseGroundStationTask() for pausing tasks from the ground station. All of the message will be saved and reload if the resumeGroundStationTask() is invoked.
    Step5 :resumeGroundStationTask() for resuming tasks.
    Step6 :closeGroundStationTask() for terminating the tasks list.

    Between Step4 and Step5, the developers could update the tasks list. However, the startWaypointIndex should be set up correctly. In addition, if the developer want to check out the tasks list in the drone, the function downloadGroundStationTask() should be invoked after step3, which means the ground station tasks could be downloaded after the ground station taks begins.



    What's more, the setJoystick function require the life cycle logically correct. There is a tutorial for constructing the life cycle.

    private OnScreenJoystick mScreenJoystick;
    private McuUpdateStateCallBack mMcuUpdateStateCallBack;
    private GroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack;

    protected void onCreat(){
      //other parameters
      mScreenJoystick.setJoystickListener();
      new Thread(){
        public void run(){
          DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation(). setAircraftJoystick();
       &emsp}
      }
      mMcuUpdateStateCallBack = new();
      mGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack = new();
    }

    protected void onResume(){
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().startUpdateTimer();
      DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation().startUpdateTimer();
    }

    protected void onPause(){
      DJIDrone.getDjiMC().stopUpdateTimer();
      DJIDrone.getDjiGroundStation().stopUpdateTimer();
    }



    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

    • Method Detail

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int interval)
        Start upating timer and set the interval between each update. The timer will request the information of ground station execution status. Once SDK receives information from flight control, SDKã€€will invoke a callback function. This callback function could be set up by setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack.
        Please note that the interval could not be lower than 100ms.
        Overrides:
        startUpdateTimer in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        interval - Timer run interval
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully starting Update timer.
            false for informing failure.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStation.startUpdateTimer(int), DJIGroundStation.startUpdateTimer(int), DJIGroundStationFlyingInfo, setGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack(DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack)

      • closeGroundStation

        public void closeGroundStation(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)

        Overrides:

        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • uploadGroundStationTask

        public void uploadGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationTask task,
                                    DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Upload ground station task. This function will upload the ground station tasks to the aircraft. Once the aircraft receives the tasks, it will replace the original tasks with the new one that app sends to aircraft.
        Please remember if you upload the tasks, only the original list of tasks in aircraft would be updated and none of them would be executed until you invoke startGroundStationTask(). The maximum number of waypoint list is 16.
        Overrides:
        uploadGroundStationTask in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        task - The ground station task
        mCallBack - The ground station execute callBack which will return the executed result of execution.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - the result will reflect the status of ground station, such as GS_Result_Success.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • startGroundStationTask

        public void startGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)

        Overrides:

        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • pauseGroundStationTask

        public void pauseGroundStationTask(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Pause ground station task. If the developers invoke this function, the execution will be paused and the information as well as the setting will be saved until the continueGroundStationTask is invoke.
        Overrides:
        pauseGroundStationTask in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The ground station hover callBack which will return the executed result of pausing.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - the result will reflect the status of GroundStation pause.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

      • oneKeyFly

        public void oneKeyFly(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)

      • goHome

        public void goHome(DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Go home. Once the aircraft get the GPS location, it will remark it and set it as the home location. If the app send a command for calling the aircraft to return home, the aircraft will use the information of homepoint to go home.
        Overrides:
        goHome in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:

        Set Aircraft Yaw Speed
        Overrides:
        setAircraftYawSpeed in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        yawSpeed - Aircraft yaw rotate speed[-1000 ~ 1000]. The yaw rotate speed reflects the angular speed from -150 degree/s to 150 degree/s.
        mCallBack - The ground station execute callBack which will return the executed result of tasks.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - the result will reflect the status of the ground station setting, such as GS_Result_Began.

      • setAircraftJoystick

        public void setAircraftJoystick(int yawSpeed,
                                int pitchSpeed,
                                int rollSpeed,
                                int throttle,
                                DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack)
        Set Aircraft JoyStick Attitude. JoyStick in this api provides a virutal operator for controlling the aircraft. This function require the life cycle of DJIGroundStationExecuteCallBack mCallBack should be correctly set up (You could find the set up tutorial in instruction of this class.)
        Overrides:
        setAircraftJoystick in class DJIGroundStation
        Parameters:
        yawSpeed - Aircraft yaw rotate speed[-1000 ~ 1000]
        pitchSpeed - Aircraft pitch rotate speed[-1000 ~ 1000]
        rollSpeed - Aircraft roll rotate speed[-1000 ~ 1000]
        throttle - Aircraft roll rotate speed[0 stop,1 up, 2 down]
        mCallBack - The ground station execute callBack which will return the executed result of tasks.

        onResult(DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult result) - the result will reflect the status of the ground station setting, such as GS_Result_Began.
        See Also:
        DJIGroundStationTypeDef.GroundStationResult

        Overrides:
        getGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack in class DJIGroundStation
        Returns:
        DJIGroundStationFlyingInfoCallBack which contains the basic of flight information, such the value of pitch, roll and yaw, gps, velocity.
